But there are a number of different reasons why a developer might not want to publish their repository to HACS, for these situations you can in many cases add it to HACS as a custom repository.

:::warning Not all repositories will work in HACS, since HACS still needs the repository to have a known structure. :::

If you want to try and add a custom repository to HACS do the following:

  1. Go to any of the sections (integrations, frontend, automation).
  2. Click on the 3 dots in the top right corner.
  3. Select "Custom repositories"
  4. Add the URL to the repository.
  5. Select the correct category.
  6. Click the "ADD" button.

:::tip The "Custom repositories" option might be hidden while background tasks is running to stop the user to break their instance. Wait a while or/and check HACS status. :::
